title: Thepla And A Drink: Liquor On Debut Surat-Bangkok Flight Runs Out, Officials Say... - NDTV
summary:
Liquor Runs Out on Inaugural Surat-Bangkok Flight, Say Passengers

Date: December 24, 2024 | Source: NDTV

Air India Express' debut flight from Surat to Bangkok experienced high demand for liquor, with claims from passengers that the stock had run out, though officials disputed this.

  • The inaugural flight lasted four hours and had 175 passengers aboard.
  • Officials stated that there was sufficient liquor and food on the flight contrary to social media claims.
  • Liquor use is banned in Gujarat; however, it was available on this private flight.
  • Passengers were served different types of liquors with varying prices during the flight.
The airline offers five types of liquor onboard. A 50 ml of Chivas Regal is priced at ₹ 600.

Overall, despite some complaints, the airline maintained they had enough stock to serve all passengers.
newTitle: Liquor Runs Out on Inaugural Surat-Bangkok Flight, Say Passengers

title: JSW Steel, Tata Steel, Jindal Steel and Power: Steel stocks likely to rise today; here is why - Upstox
summary:
Steel Stocks Rally as India Probes Increase in Steel Imports

Date: December 23, 2023

Source: PTI

Shares of leading steel manufacturers like JSW Steel, Tata Steel, and Jindal Steel saw gains of up to 2% following a government investigation into rising steel imports based on a complaint from the Indian Steel Association.

  • JSW Steel shares traded 2% higher at ₹935.45.
  • Tata Steel shares increased by 2% reaching ₹143.42.
  • SAIL stocks rose 1.5% to ₹117.94.
  • The Directorate General of Trade Remedies (DGTR) initiated an investigation into 'Non-Alloy and Alloy Steel Flat Products'.
  • The investigation follows claims of significant injury to the domestic steel industry due to increased imports.
  • The Indian Steel Association has requested the imposition of a safeguard duty on these imports to protect local manufacturers.
The applicant has alleged that there is a 'recent, sudden, sharp, and significant' increase in the volume of imports, which has caused 'significant' injury to the domestic industry in India.

This investigation aims to provide a level playing field for domestic stakeholders amid rising import volumes and potential impacts on the local market.
newTitle: Steel Stocks Rally as India Probes Increase in Steel Imports

title: Who is Lauren Sanchez? Woman at the center of Jeff Bezos’ $600 million wedding rumor - The Times of India
Epigamia CEO Rohan Mirchandani dies of sudden cardiac arrest: What causes it in your 40s? - The Indian Express
summary:
Epigamia CEO Rohan Mirchandani dies of sudden cardiac arrest: What causes it in your 40s?

Publication Date: December 23, 2024 | Source: Indian Express

The sudden passing of Rohan Mirchandani, CEO of Epigamia, has raised concerns about the rising incidence of sudden cardiac arrest among younger individuals, highlighting the need for early heart health checks in India.

  • Sudden cardiac arrest can affect anyone regardless of age, with individuals over 40 facing higher risks from coronary artery disease.
  • Heart attacks and sudden cardiac arrests are different; heart attacks involve blocked arteries, while cardiac arrests are typically related to electrical issues in the heart.
  • Younger individuals (under 35) may experience sudden cardiac arrest due to congenital defects or genetic abnormalities like Hypertrophic Cardiomyopathy.
  • Recognizing the signs and symptoms is crucial, as there is a very limited window for effective treatment—primarily CPR and defibrillation.
  • Public awareness and training in CPR is significantly lower in India compared to countries like the US, where 85% of individuals are trained.
“We should make a serious attempt to keep our heart conditions in check early in life as we are genetically more prone to developing heart diseases.”

In conclusion, Rohan Mirchandani’s passing serves as a vital reminder about the importance of heart health checks and awareness around cardiac conditions, particularly in a country facing high rates of heart disease.
newTitle: Epigamia CEO Rohan Mirchandani dies of sudden cardiac arrest: Understanding the Causes

title: Zomato shares set for Sensex inclusion from today; check FULL LIST of 30 shares - ET Now
summary:
Zomato Shares Included in BSE Sensex from Today

Updated on December 23, 2024 | Source: ET NOW

Online food delivery giant Zomato is set to join the benchmark BSE Sensex index today as a part of the regular rejig, replacing JSW Steel.

  • Zomato's inclusion is anticipated to attract significant fund flows estimated at $513 million.
  • In contrast, JSW Steel could experience outflows of about $252 million.
  • The company's shares have risen dramatically, delivering a 126% return in the last year and 348% over two years.
  • Zomato's current market valuation stands at Rs 2.71 akh crore.
“Zomato's inclusion in Sensex marks a significant milestone,” states brokerage firm Nuvama.

The reshuffle not only affects the Sensex but also adjusts other indices, including the BSE 100 and BSE Sensex 50.

Overall, this change highlights Zomato's growing prominence in the Indian stock market.

title: Singapore Post fires CEO, other senior leaders amid whistleblowing charges | Company Business News - Mint
summary:
Singapore Post Dismisses CEO Amid Whistleblower Allegations

Published Date: [Insert Publication Date Here] Source: Bloomberg

Singapore Post Ltd. has terminated its CEO, Vincent Phang, and other senior executives due to allegations of misconduct following a whistleblower report.

Key Points:

  • SingPost launched an investigation after receiving a whistleblower report regarding manual data alterations to avoid contract penalties.
  • Three managers were dismissed, and a police report was filed against them.
  • Phang and other executives were deemed “grossly negligent” and have contested their terminations.
  • SingPost plans to appoint a new CEO and will pay a settlement to the affected customer without impacting its financial results.
“The allegations are without merits, and procedurally unfair,” stated Phang and Yik.

This incident highlights significant challenges in corporate governance at SingPost as it seeks to restore integrity and trust.
newTitle: Singapore Post Dismisses CEO Amid Whistleblower Allegations

title: From a lifetime high to a 35% crash, four factors weighing on Tata Motors’ stock - The Economic Times
Pegasus, again - The Times of India
summary:
Pegasus, again

Date: 2023-10-25 Source: The Times of India

Spyware controversy keeps resurfacing as institutional weaknesses remain unresolved

After five years of litigation, WhatsApp is claiming victory as a US court has found that Israeli tech company NSO, maker of spyware Pegasus, violated both US laws and WhatsApp’s own terms of service. The spyware has been used to surveil targets including journalists, opposition politicians, and even government ministers. The tension surrounding this issue highlights the urgent need to balance privacy with security in India.

  • WhatsApp wins case against NSO regarding spyware usage.
  • Reports of targeted surveillance in India raise concerns about privacy.
  • Supreme Court committee found malware on devices but can't confirm it was Pegasus.
  • Lack of independent oversight of surveillance agencies in India.
  • Historical comparisons to post-Watergate reforms in the US regarding surveillance powers.
“National security cannot be the bugbear that the judiciary shies away from.”

This ongoing spyware controversy emphasizes the need for stronger institutional safeguards to protect individual privacy while ensuring national security.
newTitle: Spyware Controversy Resurfaces Amid Institutional Weaknesses

summary:
Two Air India Passengers Fight Over Armrest Before Landing in Delhi

Publication Date: December 22, 2024 Source: Hindustan Times

Two passengers on an Air India flight from Copenhagen to Delhi engaged in a physical altercation over armrest space just before landing. The argument escalated after the cabin crew intervened during meal service.

  • The incident occurred on a flight that landed at Indira Gandhi International Airport.
  • The argument began during meal service when cabin crew strived to manage the situation.
  • Even after being separated by the cabin crew, the passengers clashed again while retrieving baggage after landing.
  • Air India officials reported that the dispute was eventually resolved with both passengers shaking hands before departing the airport.
  • The flight was reportedly nearly full, but the exact passenger count remains unclear.
“There was an argument between the two passengers over some issue but it was resolved amicably. They even shook hands before leaving the airport.” - Air India Official

This incident underscores ongoing tensions that can arise during flights, particularly regarding personal space and comfort.
newTitle: Two Air India Passengers Fight Over Armrest Before Landing in Delhi
